revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Proxim |model=AP-2000 |revision= |asin= |manuf_country= |is_manuf=No |manuf= |availability=EoL |est_release_date= |fcc_date= |fcc_id= |pcb_id= |type=access point |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=5 |pwr_conn=other |cpu1_brand=Intel StrongARM |cpu1_model=SA-110;i21281EB; |cpu1_cspeed=233 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=STMicro |fla1_model=M58LW0320-110N6 |fla1_num=2 |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=ICSI |ram1_model=IS42S16400-7T |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=PCMCIA (32-bit) |expansion_pcmcia_num=2 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=yes,, console,, DE-9 |wi1_module=Proxim 8800-FC |wi1_module_if=PCMCIA (32-bit) |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR5212 |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR5111 |wi1_chip3_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip3_model=AR2111 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi2_module=Agere PC50E-8-FC/A |wi2_module_if=PCMCIA (32-bit) |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR5210 |wi2_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip2_model=AR5110 |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=a |wi2_ant_conn= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=National Semiconductor |eth_chip1_model=DP83815 |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= <!-- Intel;i21285AB;;1;,,, PC Card Controller;Texas Instrument;PCI1225PDV;;1;,,, Ethernet Controller;National Semiconductor;DP83815CVNG;;1; --> |flags= |stock_os=VxWorks |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abg |default_ssid=My Wireless Network A,My Wireless Network B |default_ssid_regex=^My Wireless Network [AB]{1}$ |default_ip=10.0.0.1 |default_user= |default_pass=public |oui= |oui_eth= }} :Sold by ''[[Dell]]'' as the TrueMobile 1170.
Device uses a [[Intel StrongARM]] SA-110 (part number 21281EB), :[[Intel]] 21285AB, [[TI]] PCI bus PCI1225PDV for the PC Card :controller, and [[NS]] DP83815CVNG for the ethernet controller.
The AP-2000 (with [[Lucent]]/[[Agere]]/[[Proxim]]'s firmware) :can function as a 802.11b access point using: *an [[ORiNOCO PC Card]] or [[ORiNOCO PC Card (Ruby)]], *an 802.11bg access point using a [[Proxim 8800-FC]], and *an 802.11a access point using an [[Agere PC50E-8-FC/A]].
Some AP2ks have native PoE capability - for example, the [[Agere ORiNOCO AP-2000 AE]]. :This specific one, as shown in the photos, specifically does not appear to. The non-PoE capable AP-2ks could use optional POE splitters, which were :frequently used with a proprietary PowerDsine 48V system.
===See also=== *[[Agere ORiNOCO AP-2000 AE]] *[[Lucent ORiNOCO AS-2000]] *[[Proxim ORiNOCO AP-2000]]
